Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:1: O men, fear your Lord who created you from a single soul, and from it created its match, and spread many men and women from the two.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:2: Give the orphans their property, and do not substitute what is bad for what is good, and do not eat up their property along with your own.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:3: If you fear that you will not do justice to the orphans, then, marry the women you like, in twos, in threes and in fours.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:4: Give women their dower in good cheer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:5: Do not give the feeble-minded your property that Allah has made a means of support for you, and do feed them from it, and clothe them, and speak to them in fair words.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:6: Test the orphans until they reach the marriageable age.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:7: For men there is a share in what the parents and the nearest of kin have left.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:8: If the relatives (who are not heirs) and the orphans and the needy are present at the time of distribution, give them some of it, and speak to them in fair words.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:9: Those people should be fearful (in their behavior towards orphans) who, if they leave behind some helpless children, would remain anxious for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:10: Surely, those who unjustly devour the property of the orphans do nothing but devour fire into their bellies, and soon they shall enter a blazing Hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:11: Allah directs you concerning your children: for a male there is a share equal to that of two females.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:12: For you there is one-half of what your wives leave behind, in case they have no child.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:13: These are the limits set by Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:14: Whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses the limits set by Him, He shall admit him to the Fire, where he will remain forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:15: Those of your women who commit the shameful act, have four witnesses (against them) from among you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:16: Those two of you who commit it, chastise both of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:17: The relenting taken by Allah upon Himself is for those who do evil in ignorance, then repent shortly thereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:18: The relenting is not for those who do the evil deeds, until when the time of death approaches one of them, he says, “Now I repent”, nor for those who die while they are still disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:19: O you who believe, it is not lawful for you that you should forcibly take women as inheritance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:20: If you want to take a wife in place of the one (you have), and you have given her plenty of wealth, then do not take any of it back.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:21: How can you take it when you have had access to each other and they have taken a firm covenant from you?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:22: Do not marry those women whom your fathers had married except what has passed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:23: Prohibited for you are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your paternal aunts, your maternal aunts, daughters of brother, daughters of sister, your mothers who suckled you, your sisters through suckling,mothers of your wives and your step-daughters under your care who are born of your women with whom you have had intercourse,-though if you have not had intercourse with them, there is no sin on you,-and the wives of your sons from your loins, and that you combine two sisters (in wedlock), except what has passed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:24: (Also prohibited are) the women already bound in marriage, except the bondwomen you come to own.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:25: If one cannot afford to marry the free Muslim women, then (he may marry) the one you people own of your Muslim girls.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:26: Allah intends (through this Qur’ān) to explain to you (the rules) and to guide you to the ways of those (prophets who passed) before you, and to turn graciously towards you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:27: Allah intends to turn graciously towards you, while those who follow desires want you to deviate (from the right path), a huge deviation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:28: Allah intends to make things easy on you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:29: O you who believe, do not devour each other’s property by false means, unless it is trade conducted with your mutual consent.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:30: Whoever does that out of aggression and injustice, We shall cast him into the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:31: If you abstain from the major (sins) out of what you have been forbidden from, We shall write off your minor sins, and shall admit you to a noble entrance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:32: Do not covet something in which Allah has made some of you superior to others.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:33: For everyone We have made heirs in what the parents and the nearest of kin have left.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:34: Men are caretakers of women, since Allah has made some of them excel the others, and because of the wealth they have spent.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:35: If you fear a split between them (the spouses), send one arbitrator from his people and one from her people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:36: Worship Allah, and do not associate with Him anything, and be good to parents and to kinsmen and orphans and the needy and the close neighbor and the distant neighbor and the companion at your side and the wayfarer and to those (slaves who are) owned by you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:37: -those who are miserly and bid people to be miserly, and conceal what Allah has given them of His grace - and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:38: and (for) those who spend their wealth only to show people, and do not believe in Allah and the Last Day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:39: What harm was there for them if they had believed in Allah and the Last Day, and spent out of what Allah had given them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:40: Surely, Allah does not wrong (anyone), even to the measure of a particle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:41: Then, how (awful a spectacle) would it be when We shall bring a witness from every community, and shall bring you over them as a witness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:42: On that Day, those who have disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger shall wish that the earth were leveled with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:43: O you who believe! Do not go near Salāh when you are intoxicated, until you know what you say, nor in a state of ‘major impurity’.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:44: Have you not observed those who have been given a share from the Book? They buy misguidance and wish that you (too) lose the way.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:45: But Allah knows your enemies very well.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:46: Among the Jews there are some who distort the words against their contexts, and say, “We hear and disobey,” and “Hear.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:47: O you who have been given the Book, believe in what We have revealed confirming what is with you, before We rub off faces and turn them shaped like their backs, or lay a curse upon them, as We cursed the People of the Sabbath.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:48: Surely, Allah does not forgive that a partner is ascribed to Him, and He forgives anything short of that for whomsoever He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:49: Have you not seen those who claim sanctity for themselves? In fact, Allah sanctifies whom He wills, and they shall not be wronged even to the measure of a thread of a date-stone.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:50: See how they fabricate a lie against Allah, and it is enough to be an open sin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:51: Have you not seen those who have been given a share from the Book? They believe in Jibt and Tāghūt and say concerning those who disbelieve, “They are better guided in their way than those who believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:52: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, and the one whom Allah has cursed, for him you shall find no helper.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:53: Is it that they have a share in the kingdom? If so, they would give nothing to the people, not even to the measure of a tiny pit on the back of a date-stone?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:54: Or, is it that they are jealous of people over what Allah has given them of His bounty, while We have given to the House of Ibrāhīm the Book and the wisdom, and We have given to them a great kingdom?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:55: So, there were some among them who believed in it, and there were others among them who turned away from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:56: Those who have disbelieved in Our verses, We shall certainly make them enter a fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:57: As for those who have believed and have done good deeds, We shall admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:58: Surely, Allah commands you to deliver trusts to those entitled to them, and that, when you judge between people, judge with justice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:59: O you who believe, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:60: Have you not seen those who claim that they have believed in what was revealed to you and what was revealed before you? They want to take their disputes to the Tāghūt, while they were ordered to reject it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:61: When it is said to them, “Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,” you will see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:62: But, how (apologetic) they are when they suffer a calamity because of the acts of their own hands, and they come to you swearing by Allah, “We meant nothing but to promote good and bring about harmony.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:63: Those are the ones Allah knows what is in their hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:64: We did not send any Messenger but to be obeyed by the leave of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:65: So, never by your Lord! Never shall they become believers, unless they make you the judge in the disputes that arise between them, then find no discomfort in their hearts against what you have decided, and surrender to it in total submission.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:66: If We had prescribed for them that they should kill themselves or that they should migrate from their homeland, they would have not done it, except a few of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:67: In that case, We would certainly have given them a great reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:68: and we would certainly have led them to a straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:69: Those who obey Allah and the Messenger are with those whom Allah has blessed, namely, the prophets, the Siddiqīn, the Shuhadā’ and the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:70: That grace is from Allah; and Allah is sufficient as being the One who knows.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:71: O you who believe, be on your guard, and march in groups, or march all together.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:72: Among you there is one who shall invariably fall back; then, if some calamity befalls you, he would say, “Allah has shown His favor to me, as I was not present with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:73: And if some bounty comes to you from Allah, he will certainly say,-as if there was no friendship between you and him- “Oh, would that I had been with them; then I would have secured a handsome gain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:74: So, those who sell the worldly life for the Hereafter should fight in the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:75: What has happened to you that you do not fight in the way of Allah, and for the oppressed among men, women and children who say, “Our Lord, take us out from this town whose people are cruel, and make for us a supporter from Your own, and make for us a helper from Your own.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:76: The believers fight in the way of Allah, and the disbelievers fight in the way of Tāghūt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:77: Have you not seen those to whom it was said, “Hold your hands (from fighting) and be steadfast in Salāh and pay Zakāh.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:78: Wherever you will be, Death will overtake you, even though you are in fortified castles.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:79: Whatever good comes to you, it is from Allah and whatever evil visits you, it comes from your own selves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:80: Whoever obeys the Messenger obeys Allah, and whoever turns away, then, We did not send you to stand guard over them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:82: Do they not, then, ponder about the Qur’ān? Had it been from someone other than Allah, they would have found in it a great deal of discrepancy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:83: When news concerning peace or fear comes to them, they go about spreading it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:84: So, fight in the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:85: Whoever makes a good recommendation, there shall be for him a share from it (in the Hereafter), and whoever makes a bad recommendation, there shall be for him a share from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:86: When you are greeted with a salutation, greet with one better than it, or return the same.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:87: Allah: There is no god but He.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:88: So, what is the matter with you that you have become two groups about the hypocrites, while Allah has reverted them because of what they did.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:89: They wish that you should disbelieve, as they have disbelieved, and thus you become all alike.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:90: Except those who join a group between whom and you there is a treaty, or who come to you with their hearts feeling discomfort in fighting either against you or against their own people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:91: You will find others who want to be secure from you, and secure from their own people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:92: It is not for a believer (Muslim) to kill any believer, except by mistake.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:93: Whoever kills a believer deliberately, his reward is Jahannam (Hell) where he shall remain forever, and Allah shall be angry with him and shall cast curse upon him, and He has prepared for him a mighty punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:94: O you who believe, when you go out in the way of Allah, be careful, and do not say to the one who offers you the Salām (salutation), “You are not a believer” to seek stuff of the worldly life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:95: Those among the believers who sit back, except the handicapped, are not equal to those who fight in the way of Allah with their riches and their lives.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:96: - high ranks from Him and forgiveness and mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:97: Those whose souls the angels take while they had wronged themselves, the angels say (to them), “In what business were you (involved)?” They say, “We were oppressed in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:98: except the oppressed men and women and children, who cannot have means (to emigrate), nor can find a way.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:99: As for such, it is likely that Allah would pardon them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:100: Whoever migrates in the way of Allah shall find on the earth many a place to settle, and a wide dimension (of resources).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:101: When you travel on the earth, there is no sin on you in shortening your Salāh, if you fear that the disbelievers would put you in trouble.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:102: When you (O prophet) are in their midst, and arrange for them the Salāh, then, a party from them should stand with you, and should take their arms along.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:103: Once you have finished your Salāh, then, remember Allah while standing, sitting and reclining.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:104: Do not show weakness in pursuing these people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:105: Surely, We have revealed to you the Book with the truth, so that you may judge between people according to what Allah has shown you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:107: Do not argue on behalf of those who betray themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:108: They feel shy before people, but do not feel shy before Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:109: Look, this is what you are! You have argued for them in the worldly life, but who shall argue for them with Allah on the Day of Judgement, or who shall be their defender?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:110: Whoever acts evil or wrongs himself, then seeks forgiveness from Allah, shall find Allah Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:111: Whoever commits a sin, commits it only against himself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:112: Whoever commits a vice or a sin, then shifts its blame to an innocent person, he indeed takes the burden of a false imputation and a glaring sin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:113: If the grace of Allah and His mercy had not been with you, a group from them had resolved to mislead you, while they mislead none but themselves; and they can do you no harm.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:114: There is no good in most of their whisperings, unless one bids charity or a fair action, or reconciliation between people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:115: Whoever breaks away with the Messenger after the right path has become clear to him, and follows what is not the way of the believers, We shall let him have what he chose, and We shall admit him to Jahannam, which is an evil place to return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:116: Surely, Allah does not forgive that a partner is ascribed to Him, and forgives anything short of that for whomsoever He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:117: They invoke none, besides Him, but feminine objects; and they invoke none but Satan, the rebel
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:119: and I will lead them astray, and I will tempt them with false hopes, and I will command them, whereby they shall slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them, whereby they shall alter the creation of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:120: He (the Satan) makes promises to them, and he tempts them with hopes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:121: As for such people, their refuge is Jahannam, and they shall find no escape from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:122: Those who believe and do good deeds, We shall admit them to the gardens beneath which rivers flow.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:123: This is not (a matter of) your fancies or the fancies of the People of the Book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:124: Whoever, male or female, does good deeds and is a believer, then such people shall enter Paradise, and they shall not be wronged in the least.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:125: Who is better in Faith than one who has surrendered his self to Allah and is good in deeds, and has followed the creed of Ibrāhīm, the upright.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:126: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:128: If a woman fears ill treatment or aversion from her husband, then, there is no sin on them in entering into a compromise between them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:129: You shall never be able to maintain real equality between wives, even though you are eager to.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:130: If they separate, Allah shall, through His capacity, make each of them need-free (of the other).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:131: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:132: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and Allah is enough to trust in.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:133: If He so wills, He can remove you, O men, and bring others (in your place).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:134: Whoever seeks the reward of this world, then, with Allah is the reward of this world and of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:135: O you who believe, be upholders of justice - witnesses for Allah, even though against (the interest of) your selves or the parents, and the kinsmen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:136: O you who believe, do believe in Allah and His Messenger and in the Book He has revealed to His Messenger and in the Books He has revealed earlier.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:137: Surely, those who believed and then disbelieved, believed again and then disbelieved, then went on increasing in their disbelief - Allah is not to forgive them nor lead them on the path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:138: Give the hypocrites the ‘good news’ that for them there is a painful punishment
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:139: - those who take the disbelievers for friends rather than the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:140: and He has revealed to you in the Book that when you hear the verses of Allah being disbelieved and ridiculed, you should not sit with them unless they enter into some other discourse.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:141: - those who look for (a misfortune for) you, so, if there is a victory for you, they say, “Were we not with you?” But if there is a gain for the disbelievers, they say (to them), “Had we not overpowered you, still protected you from the believers?” So, Allah will decide between you on the Doomsday.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:142: Surely, the hypocrites (try to) deceive Allah while He is the One who leaves them in deception.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:143: wavering between (this and) that, neither here nor there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:144: O you who believe, do not take the disbelievers for friends instead of the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:145: Surely, the hypocrites are in the lowest level of the Fire, and you shall never find for them a helper
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:146: - except those who repent and correct themselves and hold on to Allah and make their Faith pure for Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:147: What would Allah get by punishing you, if you are grateful and believe? Allah is Appreciating, All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:148: Allah does not like the evil words to be said openly except from anyone wronged.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:149: If you do a good act openly or do it in secret, or forgive an evil deed, then, Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Powerful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:150: Surely those who disbelieve in Allah and His Messengers, and wish to make division between Allah and His Messengers, and say, “We believe in some (messengers) and disbelieve in some others” and wish to take a way in between that,-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:151: - those are the disbelievers in reality, and We have prepared a humiliating punishment for the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:152: Those who have believed in Allah and His Messengers, and have made no division between any of them, to them He will give their rewards.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:153: The People of the Book ask you to bring down upon them a Book from the heavens, (which is not strange,) as they had asked Mūsā something greater than that when they said, “Make us see Allah openly.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:154: We raised the (Mount of) Tūr high over them for binding them to the pledge, and We said to them, “Do not transgress in (the matter of) the Sabbath.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:155: So, (they met their fate) for breaking their pledge, and for their disbelief in the verses of Allah, and for their slaying of the prophets unjustly, and for their saying, “Our hearts are sealed” - rather, Allah has set a seal over them for their disbelief, so they do not believe but a little
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:156: - and for their disbelief and for what they said against Maryam as a grim imputation,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:157: and for their saying, “We have certainly killed the MasīH ‘Īsā the son of Maryam, the Messenger of Allah”, while in fact they did neither kill him, nor crucify him, but they were deluded by resemblance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:158: but Allah lifted him towards Himself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:159: No one will remain from among the People of the Book but will certainly believe in him before he dies, and on the Day of Doom, he shall be a witness against them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:160: So, because of the transgression of those who became Jews, We prohibited for them good things which were made lawful for them earlier and for their preventing (people), very often, from the way of Allah,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:161: and for their charging Ribā (usury or interest) while they were forbidden from it, and for their devouring of the properties of the people by false means.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:162: But those well-grounded in knowledge among them, and the believers, believe in what has been revealed to you and what has been revealed before you, -as well as those observing Salāh and paying Zakāh, and those believing in Allah and the Last Day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:163: Surely, We have revealed to you as We have revealed to NūH and to the prophets after him; and We have revealed to Ibrāhīm, Ismā‘īl, IsHāq, Ya‘qūb and their children, and to ‘Īsā, Ayyūb, Yūnus, Hārūn and Sulaimān, and We have given Zabūr to Dawūd .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:164: (We have sent) some Messengers We have already told you about, and some other Messengers We did not tell you about, and Allah has spoken to Mūsā verbally
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:165: - Messengers giving good tidings and warning, so that people may have no plea against Allah after the Messengers (have come).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:166: But Allah bears witness that what He has revealed to you, has revealed it with His knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:167: Surely, those who disbelieved and prevented (people) from the way of Allah have gone far astray.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:168: Surely, those who disbelieved and transgressed, Allah is not going to forgive them, nor to lead them to a way
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:169: other than the way of Jahannam where they are to remain for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:170: O people, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:171: O people of the Book, be not excessive in your Faith, and do not say about Allah anything but the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:172: The MasīH shall never spurn to be a slave of Allah, nor shall the angels who are stationed near to Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:173: As for those who believe and do good deeds, He shall give them their reward in full, and give them more out of His grace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:174: O people, a proof has come to you from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a vivid light.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:175: Now those who believe in Allah and hold on to Him - He shall admit them into Mercy from Him, and Grace, and shall lead them to Himself through a straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 4:176: They seek a ruling from you.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:1: O people, fear your Lord, Who created you of a single soul, and from it created its mate, and from the pair of them scattered many men and women; and fear God by whom you claim [your rights] from one another and kinship ties.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:2: Give the orphans their property and do not exchange the evil for the good, and absorb not their property into your property; surely that is a great crime:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:3: If you fear that you will not act justly towards the orphans, marry such women as seem good to you, two or three or four, but if you fear you will not be equitable, then only one, or what your right hands own; thus, it is likelier that you will not be unjust.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:4: And give women their dowries as a free gift; but if they are pleased to offer you any of it of their own accord, consume it with wholesome appetite.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:5: But do not give to the foolish your property, which God has assigned to you as maintenance; provide for them thereof, and clothe them, and speak to them decent words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:6: Try well the orphans until they reach the age of marrying; then, if you perceive in them maturity, deliver their property to them; consume it not wastefully and in haste, lest they should grow up.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:7: To the men belongs a share of what parents and kinsmen leave, and to the women belongs a share of what parents and kinsmen leave, whether it be little or much - an obligatory share.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:8: And when the division is attended by kinsmen, and orphans, and the poor, grant them out of it; and speak to them honourable words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:9: And let them fear those who, if they leave behind them weak offspring would be afraid for them; let them fear God and speak pertinent words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:10: Those who consume the property of orphans unjustly, are only consuming fire in their bellies and they shall be exposed a blaze.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:11: God charges you concerning your children, to the male the equivalent of the portion of two females; and if they be women more than two, then for them two-thirds of what he leaves; but if she be one then to her a half; and to his parents, to each one of the two the sixth of what he leaves, if he has a child; but if he has no child, and his heirs are his parents, then to his mother a third; or, if he has siblings, to his mother a sixth after any bequest that he may bequeath, or any debt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:12: And for you a half of what your wives leave, if they have no children; but if they have children, then for you a fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they may bequeath, or any debt: a fourth of what you leave, if you have no children; but if you have children, then for them an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you may bequeath, or any debt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:14: But whoever disobeys God, and His Messenger; and transgresses His bounds, him He will admit to a Fire, abiding therein, and for him there shall be a humbling chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:15: [As for those of your women who commit lewdness, call four of you to witness against them; and if they witness, then detain them in their houses until death take them or God appoints for them a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:16: And when two of you commit it, punish them both; but if they repent and make amends, then leave them be.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:18: The repentance that God accepts is only of those who do evil in ignorance; then repent shortly thereafter; God will relent to those.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:19: Repentance is not for those who do evil deeds until, when death approaches one of them, he says, 'Indeed now I repent'; neither for those who die disbelieving.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:20: O you who believe, it is not lawful for you to inherit women against their will; neither debar them, so that you may go off with part of what you have given them, except when they commit flagrant lewdness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:21: And if you desire to exchange a wife in place of another, and you have given to one a hundredweight, take of it nothing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:22: How shall you take it, when each of you has been privily with the other, and they have taken from you a solemn covenant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:23: And do not marry women whom your fathers married, unless it be a thing of the past; surely that is obscene and abominable, an evil way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:24: Forbidden to you are your mothers, and daughters, your sisters, your paternal aunts, and maternal aunts, your brother's daughters, your sister's daughters, your foster mothers who have given you milk, your foster sisters, your mothers-in-law, your step-daughters, who are in your care being born of your wives you have been in to - but if you have not yet been in to them you are not at fault - and the spouses of your sons who are of your loins, and that you should take to you two sisters together unless it be a thing of the past.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:25: And wedded women, save what your right hands own, this is what God has prescribed for you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:26: And whoever has not the means wherewith to be able to marry believing women in wedlock, let him take believing maids whom your right hands own.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:27: God desires to make clear to you and to guide you in the ways of those before you, and to turn [in forgiveness] towards you; God is Knowing, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:29: towards you, but those who follow their passions, desire that you deviate with a terrible deviation.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:30: God desires to lighten things for you; for man was created weak.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:31: O you who believe, consume not your goods between you wrongly, except it be trading through mutual agreement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:32: And whoever does that through aggression and injustice, him We shall certainly expose to a fire; and that for God is an easy matter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:33: If you avoid the grave sins that are forbidden you, We will absolve you of your evil deeds and admit you by an honourable gate.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:34: Do not covet that in which God has preferred some of you above others.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:35: To each We have appointed heirs of that which parents and kinsmen leave and to those to whom your right hands were pledged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:36: Men are in charge of women because of that with which God has preferred the one over the other, and because of what they expend of their property.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:37: And if you fear a breach between the two, send forth an arbiter from his folk, and an arbiter from her folk, if they desire to set things right, God will grant them success.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:38: And worship God, and associate nothing with Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:39: Those who are niggardly, and bid other people to be niggardly, and conceal what God has bestowed upon them of His bounty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:40: And those who expend of their substance to show off to people, and believe not in God and the Last Day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:41: And what burden is on them if they were to believe in God and the Last Day, and expend of what God has provided them? God is ever Aware of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:42: Surely God shall not wrong so much as the weight of an atom; and if it be a good deed, He will double it and give from Himself a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:43: So how shall it be when We bring forward from every community a witness; and We bring you as witness against these?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:44: Upon that day, the disbelievers, those who have disobeyed the Messenger, will wish that the earth might be levelled with them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:45: O you who believe, draw not near to prayer, whilst you are inebriated, until you know what you are saying, nor whilst you are defiled, unless you are traversing a way, until you have washed yourselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:46: Have you not seen those who were given a share of the Book, purchasing error and desiring that you should err from the way?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:47: God has better knowledge of your enemies.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:48: Some from among the Jews distort the words from their contexts and they say, 'We have heard, and we disobey, and hear as one who does not hear' and, 'Mind us', twisting with their tongues and slandering religion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:49: O you who have been given the Scripture, believe in what We have revealed, confirming what is with you before We obliterate faces, and turn them inside out or curse them as We cursed those of the Sabbath, and God's command is done.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:50: God forgives not that anything should be associated with Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:51: Have you not seen those who praise themselves for purity? Nay, God purifies whom He will, and they shall not be wronged, a single date-thread.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:52: Consider how they invent falsehood against God, and that suffices for a clear sin.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:53: Have you not seen those who were given a share of the Book, how they believe in al-Jibt and al-Tāghūt, and say to the disbelievers, ‘These are more rightly guided than the believers’?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:54: Those are the ones whom God has cursed; and he whom God has cursed, you will never find for him any helper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:55: Or have they a share in the Kingdom?, then they would not give the people a single date-spot.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:56: Or, are they jealous of people for the bounty that God has bestowed upon them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:57: And there are some of them who believe in him and some of them who bar from him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:58: Surely those who disbelieve in Our signs - We shall expose them to a Fire; as often as their skins are consumed, We shall replace them with other skins, that they may taste the chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:59: And those that believe, and perform righteous deeds, We shall admit them to Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide: they shall have therein spouses purified, and We shall admit them to plenteous shade.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:60: Verily, God commands you to restore trusts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:61: O you who believe, obey God, and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:62: Have you not seen those who claim that they believe in what has been revealed to you, and what was revealed before you, desiring to take their disputes to a false deity when they have been commanded to renounce him? But Satan desires to mislead them, far astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:63: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what God has revealed and the Messenger', you see the hypocrites turn away from you vehemently.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:64: How would it be when an affliction befalls them for what their own hands have sent before them! They then come to you, swearing by God that, 'We sought only virtue and harmony'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:65: Those - God knows what is in their hearts; so turn away from them, and admonish them, and say to them regarding their souls penetrating words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:66: We never sent any Messenger, but that he should be obeyed by the leave of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:67: But no, by your Lord! They will not believe until they make you judge over what has broken out between them and find in themselves no inhibition regarding what you decide, but submit in full submission.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:68: And had We prescribed for them: 'Slay yourselves' or 'Leave your habitations', they would not have done it, save a few of them; yet if they had done what they were admonished to do, it would have been better for them, and stronger in establishing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:69: And then, We would have surely given them from Us a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:70: And We would have guided them to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:71: Whoever obeys God and the Messenger, they are with those whom God has blessed of the prophets and the truthful, and the martyrs, and the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:73: O you who believe, take your precautions, then move forward in companies, or move forward all together.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:74: Verily, there are some of you who tarry; then, if an affliction befalls you, he says, 'God has been gracious to me, for I was not a witness with them'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:75: But if a bounty from God befalls you, he will surely cry as if there had never been any affection between you and him: 'Oh, would that I had been with them, so that I might have won a great triumph!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:76: So let them fight in the way of God those who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter; and whoever fights in the way of God and is slain or conquers, We shall give him a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:77: What is wrong with you, that you do not fight in the way of God, and for the oppressed men, women, and children who say, 'Our Lord, bring us forth from this town whose people are evildoers and appoint for us a protector from You, and appoint for us from You a helper'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:78: Those who believe fight in the way of God, and those who disbelieve fight in the way of a false deity.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:79: Have you not seen those to whom it was said, 'Restrain your hands, and establish the prayer, and pay the alms'? Then, as soon as fighting was prescribed for them, lo, a party of them fear people as they would fear God, or with more fear and they said, 'Our Lord, why have You prescribed fighting for us? Why not defer us to a near term?' Say, 'The enjoyment of this world is trifling; and the Hereafter is better for him who fears; and you shall not be wronged, a single date-thread.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:80: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, though you should be in raised-up towers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:81: Whatever good befalls you it is from God; whatever evil befalls you is from yourself.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:82: Whoever obeys the Messenger, verily obeys God; and whoever turns his back, We have not sent you as a watcher over them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:83: They say, Obedience; but when they sally forth from you, a party of them harbour other than what they say.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:84: What, do they not ponder the Qur’ān? If it had been from other than God surely they would have found therein much inconsistency.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:85: And when there comes to them an issue, be it of security, or of fear, they broadcast it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:86: So fight in the way of God; you are charged only with yourself.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:87: Whoever intercedes with a good intercession shall receive a share of it; and whoever intercedes with an evil intercession, shall receive the like from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:88: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet with better than it, or return it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:89: God - there is no god except Him, He will surely gather you to the Day of Resurrection whereof there is no doubt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:90: What is wrong with you that you have become two parties, regarding the hypocrites, when God has overthrown them for what they earned? What, do you desire to guide him whom God has sent astray? And he whom God sends astray, you will never find for him a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:91: They long that you should disbelieve as they disbelieve, so then you would be equal; therefore do not take friends from among them until they emigrate in the way of God; then, if they turn away, take them and slay them wherever you find them; and do not take any of them as a patron, or as a helper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:92: Except those who attach themselves to a people between whom and you there is a covenant, or come to you with their breasts constricted about the prospect of fighting you, or fighting their people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:93: You will find others desiring to have security from you and security from their own people; yet whenever they are returned to sedition, they are overwhelmed by it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:94: It is not for a believer to slay a believer, except by mistake.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:95: And whoever slays a believer deliberately, his requital is Hell, abiding therein, and God is wroth with him and has cursed him, and has prepared for him a mighty chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:96: O you who believe, when you are going forth in the way of God, be discriminating and do not say to him who offers you peace: 'You are not a believer, desiring the transient goods of the life of this world.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:97: The believers who sit at home, other than those who have an injury are not the equals of those who struggle in the way of God with their possessions and their lives.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:98: degrees from Him, and forgiveness and mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:99: And those whom the angels take [in death], while they are wronging their souls, the angels will say, 'What was your predicament?' They will say, 'We were oppressed in the land'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:100: Except the oppressed among the men, women, and children who are unable to devise a plan and are not guided to a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:101: As for such, perhaps God will pardon them, for God is ever Pardoning, Forgiving.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:102: Whoever emigrates in the way of God will find in the earth many refuges and abundance; whoever goes forth from his house as an emigrant to God and His Messenger, and then death overtakes him, his wage is then incumbent upon God; surely God is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:103: And when you are going forth in the land you would not be at fault if you shorten the prayer if you fear that you may be afflicted by those who do not believe; the disbelievers are a manifest foe to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:104: When you are among them, and you stand to lead them in prayer, let a party of them stand with you, and let them take their weapons.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:105: When you have performed the prayer, remember God, standing and sitting and on your sides.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:106: Be not faint in seeking the enemy; if you are suffering, they are also suffering as you are suffering; and you hope from God that for which they cannot hope.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:107: Surely We have revealed to you the Book with the truth so that you may judge between people by that which God has shown you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:108: And pray for forgiveness from God; surely God is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:109: And do not dispute on behalf of those who betray themselves; surely God loves not one who is treacherous and sinful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:110: They hide themselves from people, but they do not hide themselves from God; for He is with them while they plot at night with discourse displeasing to Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:111: Ah! There you are you have contested on their behalf in the life of this world; but who will contest against God on their behalf on the Day of Resurrection, or who will be a guardian for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:112: Whoever does evil, or wrongs himself, and then prays for God's forgiveness, he shall find God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:113: And whoever commits a sin commits it against himself only; and God is ever Knower, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:114: And whoever commits a mistake or a sin, and then casts it upon the innocent, he has thereby burdened himself with calumny and a manifest sin.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:115: Were it not for God's bounty to you and His mercy, a party of them would have intended to lead you astray; but they lead only themselves astray; they will not hurt you at all.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:116: There is no good in much of their secret conversations, except for he who enjoins to voluntary almsgiving, or kindness, or setting things right between people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:117: But whoever makes a breach with the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him, and follows other than the way of the believers, We shall turn him over to what he has turned to, and We shall expose him in Hell - an evil journey's end.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:118: God does not forgive that anything should be associated with Him; He forgives all except that, to whomever He will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:119: What they pray to instead of Him are but females, and they only pray to a rebellious satan.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:121: And I will surely lead them astray, and surely I will fill them with desires; and surely I will command them and they will cut up the cattle's ears.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:122: He promises them, and fills them with desires; but what Satan promises them is only delusion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:123: For such - their abode shall be Hell, and they shall find no refuge from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:124: But those who believe and perform righteous deeds, We shall admit them to Gardens underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein for ever; God's promise in truth; and who, is truer in utterance than God?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:125: It is not your desires nor the desires of the People of the Scripture.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:126: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, and is a believer - such shall be admitted into Paradise, and not be wronged, the dint in a date-stone.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:127: And who is fairer in religion than he who submits his purpose to God and is virtuous, and who follows the creed of Abraham as a hanīf? And God took Abraham for a close friend.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:128: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth; and God is ever the Encompasser of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:129: They will ask you for a pronouncement concerning women.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:130: And if a woman fears from her husband ill-treatment or rejection, they are not at fault if they are reconciled through some agreement; reconciliation is better.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:131: You will never be able to be just to your wives, even if you be eager; yet do not turn altogether away, so that you leave her like one suspended.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:132: But if they separate, God will compensate each of them out of His plenty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:133: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:134: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth; God suffices as a Guardian.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:135: If He will, He can remove you, O people, and bring others, surely God is ever able to do that.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:136: Whoever desires the reward of this world, then God has the reward of this world and of the Hereafter; God is ever Hearer, Seer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:137: O you who believe, be upright in justice; witnesses for God, even though it be against yourselves; or parents and kinsmen, whether the person be rich or poor; God is closer to the two.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:138: O you who believe, believe in God and His Messenger and the Book which has been revealed to His Messenger; and the Book which was revealed before.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:139: Verily, those who believed, and then disbelieved, and then believed, and then disbelieved, and then increased in disbelief - it was not for God to forgive them, nor to guide them to a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:140: Give tidings to the hypocrites that for them there is a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:141: Those who take disbelievers for friends instead of believers - do they desire power with them? Truly, power belongs altogether to God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:142: It has been revealed to you in the Book that: 'When you hear God's signs being disbelieved in and mocked, do not sit with them until they engage in some other talk, for otherwise you would surely be like them'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:143: Those who wait in watch for you, and, if a victory comes to you from God, say, 'Were we not with you?'; but if the disbelievers have some luck, they say, 'Did we not gain mastery over you, and did we not defend you against the believers?' God will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection, and God will never grant the disbelievers a way over the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:144: The hypocrites seek to trick God, but He is tricking them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:145: Wavering, all the time - not to these, neither to those; and he whom God sends astray, you will never find for him a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:146: O you who believe, take not the disbelievers as friends instead of the believers: do you desire to give God over you a clear warrant?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:147: Verily, the hypocrites will be in the lowest level of the Fire; and you will never find a helper for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:148: Save those who repent, and make amends, and hold fast to God and make their religion purely God's; those are with the believers; and God will certainly give the believers a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:149: Why would God chastise you if you are thankful and believe? God is ever Thankful, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:150: God does not like the utterance of evil words out loud, unless a person has been wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:151: If you show good, or conceal it, or pardon evil, then surely God is ever Pardoning, Powerful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:152: Those who disbelieve in God and His messengers and seek to divide between God and His messengers, and say, 'We believe in some, and disbelieve in some', and seek to adopt a way between them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:153: Those are the disbelievers truly; and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:154: And those who believe in God and His messengers and do not seek to divide between any of them, those - We shall surely give them their wages.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:155: The People of the Scripture will ask of you to cause a Book to be revealed to them from the heaven.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:156: calf after clear proofs had come to them; yet We pardoned that; and We bestowed upon Moses clear authority.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:157: And We raised above them the Mount, by the covenant with them, and We said to them, 'Enter the gate, bowing'; and We said to them, 'Transgress not the Sabbath, and We took from them a firm covenant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:158: So, for their breaking their covenant and disbelieving in the signs of God, and slaying the prophets wrongfully, and for their saying, 'Our hearts are covered up' - nay, but God sealed them for their disbelief; so they do not believe, except for a few.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:159: And for their disbelief, and their uttering against Mary a tremendous calumny.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:160: And for their saying, 'We slew the Messiah, Jesus son of Mary, the Messenger of God'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:161: Nay, God raised him up to Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:162: And there is not one of the People of the Scripture but will assuredly believe in him before his death; and on the Day of Resurrection he will be a witness against them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:163: And because of the evildoing of some of those of Jewry, We have forbidden them certain good things that were lawful for them, and because of their barring from God's way, many.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:164: And because of their taking usury when they had been forbidden it, and their consuming people's wealth through falsehood, and We have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:165: But those of them who are firmly rooted in knowledge, and the believers, believing in what has been revealed to you, and what was revealed before you, and those who observe the prayer; and pay the alms, and those who believe in God and the Last Day — to them We shall surely give a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:166: We have revealed to you as We revealed to Noah, and the prophets after him, and We revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac, and Jacob, and the Tribes, and Jesus and Job and Jonah and Aaron, and Solomon, and We gave to David the Inscribed Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:167: And messengers We have told you of before, and messengers We have not told you of; and God spoke directly to Moses.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:168: messengers bearing good tidings and warning so that people might have no argument against God after the messengers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:169: But God bears witness with what He has revealed to you; He has revealed it through His knowledge; and the angels also bear witness; and God suffices as a Witness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:170: Surely those who disbelieve and bar from the way of God, they have indeed gone far astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:171: Surely those who disbelieve and who have done wrong, it is not for God to forgive them, neither to guide them to any path,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:172: except for the path of Hell, abiding, therein, forever; and for God that is an easy matter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:173: O people, the Messenger has now come to you with the truth from your Lord; so believe, it is better for you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:174: O People of the Scripture, do not go to extremes, in your religion and do not say about God except the truth: the Messiah, Jesus the son of Mary, was only the Messenger of God, and His Word which He cast to Mary, and a spirit from Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:175: The Messiah would never disdain to be a servant of God, neither would the angels who are nigh.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:176: As for those who believed, who did righteous deeds, He will pay them in full their wages, and He will give them more of His bounty; and as for them who disdain and are too proud, He will chastise them with a painful chastisement, and they shall not find for themselves, besides God, any friend or helper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:177: O people, a proof has now come to you from your Lord, and We have revealed to you a manifest light.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:178: As for those who believe in God, and hold fast to Him, He will surely admit them to mercy from Him, and bounty, and He will guide them to Him by a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 4:179: They will ask you for a pronouncement.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:1: O mankind! Fear your Lord, Who (initiated) your creation from a single soul, then from it created its mate, and from these two spread (the creation of) countless men and women.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:2: And deliver to the orphans their belongings; and do not exchange the bad for the good; nor consume their wealth by mixing it with your own.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:3: And if you have the apprehension that you will not be able to treat the orphan girls justly, then marry the women you like and who are lawful for you, two or three or four (but this sanction is conditional on justice).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:4: And pay the women their dower with a pleased heart.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:5: And do not entrust to the mentally deficient your (or their) assets which Allah has made a means of stability for your economy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:6: And evaluate and test the orphans (for the sake of their training) till they attain to (the age of) marriage.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:7: Men have a share in (the assets) that their parents and nearest kin leave behind, and women (also) have a share in the inheritance of their parents and the nearest kin.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:8: If the relatives (other than heirs) and the orphans and the indigent are present on the occasion of the division (of inheritance), give them also something out of it and say to them good and nice words.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:9: And the people (who execute matters of orphans) should fear that (whilst dying), if they were to leave tender offspring behind, (how) frightened (and worried) they would be over the plight of their children! They should, therefore, keep fearing Allah (in the matter of orphans) and should speak in a straightforward manner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:10: Indeed, those who eat up the property of orphans unjustly fill their bellies but with fire, and soon will they fall into a Blazing Fire.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:11: Allah commands you concerning (the inheritance of) your children: The share of a son is equal to that of two daughters; then if there are only daughters (two or) more, they are entitled to two-thirds of the inheritance; if there is only one daughter, her share will be one half; the mother and the father of the deceased will get one-sixth of the inheritance each if the deceased leaves children behind; but in case the deceased has no children and the heirs are only his mother and his father, the mother’s share is one-third (and the rest is the father’s); then, if he has brothers and sisters, the mother will have a sixth portion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:12: And for you, the share in the property your wives leave is one half, provided they have no children.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:13: These are the limits set by Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:14: But whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) and exceeds His limits, He will admit him to Hell wherein shall he dwell forever; and there is a humiliating torment for him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:15: And those of your women who commit adultery, call in from your men four witnesses against them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:16: And the two persons who commit adultery from amongst you, punish them both.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:17: Allah has only promised to accept the repentance of those who commit evil deeds due to ignorance and then repent soon after.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:18: But repentance is not (accepted) of the people who persist in sinful acts until death overtakes one of them, (then) he says: ‘Now I repent.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:19: O believers! It is not lawful for you to become heirs to women by force.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:20: And if you seek to take a wife in place of another and you have (by now) given to her heaps of wealth, yet do not take back any part of it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:21: And how can you take it back whilst you have had marital relations with each other, and they have (also) taken a firm promise from you?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:22: And do not marry women whom your fathers and forefathers married.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:23: Forbidden to you are your mothers and your daughters and your sisters and your father’s sisters and your mother’s sisters and your brother’s daughters and sister’s daughters and your mothers (who) have suckled you, your foster sisters and mothers of your wives.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:24: And (forbidden to you are also) women having husbands except those (prisoners of war) who come into your legal possession.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:25: And whoever of you cannot afford to marry free believing women may marry those believing slave girls who are in your possession (under Islamic law).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:26: Allah intends to explain to you (His commands) and guide you to the ways of those (pious) people who have passed before you and turn to you in mercy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:27: And Allah intends to bestow upon you His favour, but those who pursue the lusts (of the ill-commanding selves) wish you to turn far away from the right path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:28: Allah intends to lighten your burden.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:29: O believers! Do not devour one another’s wealth unlawfully amongst yourselves unless it is a trade by your mutual agreement and do not kill yourselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:30: But whoever will do that through transgression and injustice, We shall soon throw him into the Fire (of Hell) and that is very easy for Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:31: If you keep abstaining from major sins that you are forbidden to do, We shall remove from you your minor sins and shall admit you to a place of honour.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:32: And do not long for the thing in which Allah has made some of you superior to others.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:33: And We have appointed to everyone heirs of the property left by parents and near relations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:34: Men are guardians of women, because Allah has made one superior to the other, and (also) because men spend their wealth (on them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:35: And if you fear a breach between the two, then appoint one arbitrator from the husband’s family and the other from the wife’s family.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:36: And worship Allah and do not set up any partners with Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:37: Those who are miserly and bid others (also) to be miserly and hide that (blessing) which Allah has granted them of His bounty.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:38: And those who spend their wealth to show off to people, and believe neither in Allah nor in the Last Day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:39: And what loss would they have suffered, if they had believed in Allah and the Last Day, and spent (in His way) of what Allah had given them? And Allah is Well Aware of them (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:40: Surely, Allah does not do (even) an iota of injustice, and if there is a good work, He doubles it and grants from His presence an immense reward.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:41: Then how it will be on the Day when We shall bring one witness from each Umma (Community), and, (O Beloved,) We shall bring you as a witness against them all?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:42: On that Day those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) will wish that (after burying them) the earth over them were levelled.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:43: O believers! Do not go near Prayer in a drunken state until you are able to understand what you say.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:44: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the (revealed) Book? They buy misguidance, and want you (also) to turn away from the straight path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:45: And Allah knows best your enemies and Allah is Sufficient (as) a Protector and Allah is Sufficient (as) a Helper.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:46: And some amongst the Jews pervert the words (of the Torah) from their (original) places and say: ‘We have heard but we disobey,’ and (also say): ‘Listen! (God forbid!) May you not be listened to,’ and twisting their tongues, scoffing at Din (Religion) they say: ‘Ra‘ina.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:164: But those amongst them who possess substantial knowledge and faith (equally) believe in (the Revelation) that has been sent down to you and (the Revelation) that was sent down before you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:165: (O Beloved!) Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:166: And (We have sent many) Messengers whose annals We have narrated to you earlier; and We sent (a number of) those Messengers whose details We have not (yet) related to you; and Allah (also) spoke to Musa (Moses) directly.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:173: O People of the Book! Exceed not the limits in your din (religion), and speak nothing but the truth about Allah’s glory.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:174: The Messiah feels no embarrassment in being a servant of Allah.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 4:177: So, those who believe in Allah and hold fast to His (embrace, Allah) will soon admit them to His (exceptional) mercy and grace and will show them the straight path to (reach) Him.

null.verse 4:10: Ne, jotka vääryydellä nielevät orpojen omaisuuden, nielevät totisesti vain tulta vatsaansa, ja he tulevat Helvetin tulessa palamaan.
null.verse 4:11: Ne, jotka vääryydellä nielevät orpojen omaisuuden, nielevät totisesti vain tulta vatsaansa, ja he tulevat Helvetin tulessa palamaan.
null.verse 4:12: Ja teille kuuluu puolet siitä, mitä vaimonne ovat jälkeensä jättäneet, jollei heillä ole lapsia; mutta jos heillä on lapsia, tulee osallenne neljäs osa vaimojenne jäämistöstä, senjälkeen kuin heidän mahdolliset testamenttimääräyksensä ovat täytetyt tai velka on vähennetty.
null.verse 4:13: Nämä ovat Jumalan asetukset.
null.verse 4:14: Mutta sen, joka on tottelematon Jumalalle ja Hänen lähettiläälleen ja rikkoo Hänen asetuksiaan, Hän on johdattava Tuleen, jossa hän iankaikkisesti on pysyvä; häntä odottaa häpeällinen rangaistus.
null.verse 4:15: Niitä teidän naisianne vastaan, jotka tekevät huorin, on teidän kutsuttava joukostanne neljä todistajaa; jos he todistavat heidät syyllisiksi, niin pitäkää heidät eristettyinä asunnoissanne, kunnes kuolema heidät korjaa tai Jumala osoittaa heitä varten jonkun muun mahdollisuuden (uuden lainsäädännön kautta).
null.verse 4:16: Sellaiseen häpeään syyllistyviä on kumpaakin rangaistava, mutta jos he katuvat ja tekevät parannuksen, niin jättäkää heidät rauhaan.
null.verse 4:17: Sääliä riittää Jumalalta ainoastaan niille, jotka tekevät pahaa tietämättömyydessään, mutta sitten viipymättä katuvat.
null.verse 4:18: Mutta mitään armoa ei ole niille, jotka tekevät pahoja töitä aina siihen saakka, kunnes ovat kuolemaisillaan ja silloin sanovat: »Nyt minä teen totisesti parannuksen», eikä niille, jotka kuolevat uskottomuudessa; heille Me olemme valmistanut tuskallisen rangaistuksen.
null.verse 4:19: Teidän, jotka uskotte, ei ole lupa ottaa (edesmenneiden sukulaistenne) naisilta, vastoin heidän tahtoaan, heidän perintöään, eikä estää heitä menemästä naimisiin toisen kanssa, ottaaksenne heiltä takaisin osan siitä, minkä olette heille antaneet, paitsi jos he syyllistyvät ilmeiseen huoruuteen; vaan kohdelkaa heitä hyväntahtoisesti.
null.verse 4:20: Jos haluatte ottaa (uuden) vaimon toisen (erottamanne) sijaan ja olette antaneet jälkimäiselle vaikkapa suurenkin rahasumman, niin älkää ottako mitään siitä takaisin.
null.verse 4:21: Ja kuinka voisittekaan anastaa sen, kun olette viettäneet läheistä yhdyselämää toistenne kanssa ja he (vaimonne) ovat saaneet teidän juhlalliset liittolupauksenne?
null.verse 4:22: Älkää naiko niitä naisia, jotka isänne ovat naineet (ja hylänneet); poikkeus sallittakoon jo aikoja sitten tapahtuneeseen nähden.
null.verse 4:23: Kiellettyjä teiltä ovat äitinne, tyttärenne ja siskonne, sekä isän- että äidinpuoleiset tätinne, veljentyttärenne ja sisarentyttärenne, imettäjänne, jotka teitä ovat imettäneet, ja heidän tyttärensä, vaimojenne äidit ja tytärpuolenne, jotka ovat holhouksenne alaisia ja (aikoinaan) syntyneet vaimoista, joiden kanssa olette yhteydessä olleet - mutta jos ette ole olleet heidän kanssaan yhteydessä, niin ei teille lueta synniksi (naida tytärpuoli) - ja edelleen omaa vertanne olevien poikienne vaimot.
null.verse 4:24: Samoin (ovat kielletyt teiltä) kaikki naidut naiset lukuunottamatta niitä orjattaria, jotka ovat joutuneet haltuunne (oston tai sodan kautta).
null.verse 4:25: Kenellä teistä ei ole varaa naida vartioituna kasvatettua uskovaista naista, ottakoon vaimokseen jonkun niistä uskovaisista palvelijattarista (orjattarista), jotka ovat vallassanne (heimonne keskuudessa), sillä Jumala tutkii parhaiten uskonne, ja te polveudutte toinen toisistanne.
null.verse 4:26: Jumala tahtoo selittää tämän teille ja ohjata teidät niiden tielle, jotka ovat ennen teitä eläneet, ja armossaan kääntyä teidän katuvaisten puoleen.
null.verse 4:27: Jumala tahtoo peittää teidät laupeudellaan, mutta ne, jotka seuraavat himojansa, tahtovat, että te kääntyisitte kauas harhateille.
null.verse 4:28: Jumala tahtoo tehdä teidän taakkanne helpoksi, sillä ihminen on luotu heikoksi.
null.verse 4:29: Te, jotka uskotte, älkää kuluttako keskenänne omaisuuttanne turhuuksiin , paitsi jos (joku menettää sitä) jonkin liikeasian kautta, joka perustui keskinäiseen sopimukseen; älkääkä surmaa tehkö .
null.verse 4:30: mutta sen, joka näin tekee vihamielisyydessä ja vääryydessä, Me olemme Tulessa polttava, sillä se on helppoa Jumalalle.
null.verse 4:31: Jos kartatte raskaita syntejä, jotka ehdottomasti kielletään teiltä, niin Me pyyhimme pois teidän pahat tekonne ja johdatamme teidät kunniaportista Paratiisiin.
null.verse 4:32: Älkää himoitko sellaista, johon nähden Jumala on asettanut jotkut toisten suhteen korkeampaan asemaan.
null.verse 4:33: Jokaisen kohdalta Me olemme määrännyt perilliset sille,minkä vanhemmat ja lähimmät omaiset ovat jälkeensä jättäneet.
null.verse 4:34: Miehet olkoot naisten esimiehiä, koska Jumala on asettanut heidät näihin nähden korkeampaan asemaan, ja myöskin niiden suoritusten tähden, joita miesten on omaisuudestaan naisten hyväksi tehtävä.
null.verse 4:35: jos pelkäätte välien rikkoutumista miehen ja vaimon kesken, niin lähettäkää (heidän luokseen) erotuomariksi joku miehen suvusta ja toinen vaimon suvusta.
null.verse 4:36: Palvelkaa Jumalaa älkääkä mitään asettako Hänen rinnalleen.
null.verse 4:37: jotka ovat saitoja ja herättävät toisissakin ahneutta sekä vaikenevat siitä, minkä Jumala on runsaudessaan heille suonut.
null.verse 4:38: Eikä niitäkään (Jumala rakasta), jotka uhraavat varojaan ulkokultaisuudessa ihmisten nähden, mutta eivät usko Jumalaan eivätkä Viimeiseen päivään.
null.verse 4:39: Mutta mitä (pelkoa) olisi niillä, jotka uskovat Jumalaan ja Viimeiseen päivään ja tuovat rehellisesti uhrin siitä, mitä Jumala on heille suonut? Jumala tuntee heidät (kaikkine töineen).
null.verse 4:40: Totisesti Jumala ei tee kenellekään vääryyttä hitusenkaan vertaa, ja jos on olemassa hyvä työ, palkitsee Hän sen kaksinkertaisesti ja antaa luonansa suuren korvauksen.
null.verse 4:41: Mutta kuinka käykään, kun Me tuomme esiin todistajan jokaisesta kansasta ja asetamme sinut, Muhammed, todistajaksi heitä vastaan?
